narrative.narrative: REDjet was based at Grantley Adams International Airport in the Caribbean country of Barbados from May 10,2011 to March 16,2012. It began flying with a route to Georgetown,Guyana on the South American continent. On July 28,2011 it began going to Port of Spain,Trinidad and Tobago. On November 20,2011 to Kingston,Jamaica. On November 22,2011 to Saint John's,Antigua and Barbuda. And on December 16,2011 to St. Lucia. It operated with two MD-82's and an MD-83 all in a 149 passenger economy only configuration. It had planned on being based at Kingston,Jamaica but changed to Barbados when Jamaica denied permission to set up. Even after ceasing operations it had hoped to get govenment help to continue but it officially shut down on June 8th,2012.
